oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Free Hill Project chronological timeline and documentation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Dishman, Ron
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Free Hills Rd., East of TN 52, Free Hill, Clay Co., TN
Progress Report by Ron Dishman , genealogist and researcher, concerning the Free Hill Project

Free Hills Rosewald School was built from 1929 to 1930. It is a school for African Americans constructed from a fund from Sears, Roebuck & Company magnate Julius Rosenwald. Like many other Rosenwald schools, Free Hills represented a new higher level of commitment by state and local officials to the education of African Americans, though focused largely only on vocational education. The school also acted as a central place for the community to gather.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American schools -- Tennessee; School buildings -- Tennessee; Julius Rosenwald Fund -- Buildings
